posts.post_content:
The comes into play ability doesn't target, so it can copy a creature with shroud using its first ability. However, the change-during-upkeep ability DOES target, so it can't use its second ability to copy a shroud creature. Understand?   
  
This card is why I fell in love with magic. I was the only one in my circle that had one.
posts.html:
The comes into play ability doesn't target, so it can copy a creature with shroud using its first ability. However, the change-during-upkeep ability DOES target, so it can't use its second ability to copy a shroud creature. Understand?

This card is why I fell in love with magic. I was the only one in my circle that had one.

posts.post_content:
The Doppelganger is not a targeting when it comes into play, only on your upkeep it targets.
  
   
http://magiccards.info/query?q=!Vesuvan%20Doppelganger
  
   
9/16/2007: Although Vesuvan Doppelganger's triggered ability is targeted, its "as enters the battlefield" ability is not.
  
   
So yes you can cast it to have a "protection from Everything" guy too!

Posted By: Pontiac (3/24/2011 3:03:00 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Its "enters the battlefield" ability is identical to [Clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Clone) but for the extra U in the casting cost, you get the ability to recopy each upkeep anything that it can legally target. No mana costs like [Sakashima the Impostor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sakashima the Impostor) or [Vesuvan Shapeshifter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vesuvan Shapeshifter). Fabulous card, never got enough credit for being so cool.
posts.html:
Its "enters the battlefield" ability is identical to Clone but for the extra U in the casting cost, you get the ability to recopy each upkeep anything that it can legally target. No mana costs like Sakashima the Impostor or Vesuvan Shapeshifter. Fabulous card, never got enough credit for being so cool.

it cant copy a creature on the field with shroud if it is already on the field, but if you play it after the shroud, it will be able to copy the shrouded guy (check the rulings if you dont believe me)

posts.post_content: @divine\_exodus: Moreover, not only can you copy Emrakul when playing this card, as that effect does not target (as blurrymadness correctly said), but you can also copy him any turn after that, because Emrakul only has protection from coloured spells, and the doppel is necessarily no longer a spell when using the upkeep ability.
posts.html:
@divine_exodus: Moreover, not only can you copy Emrakul when playing this card, as that effect does not target (as blurrymadness correctly said), but you can also copy him any turn after that, because Emrakul only has protection from coloured spells, and the doppel is necessarily no longer a spell when using the upkeep ability.
